intro: Urtica affinis, commonly known as stinging nettle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North America. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves with stinging hairs that release irritants when touched. The plant typically grows to a height of 60–120 cm and produces small, greenish flowers in clusters. Urtica affinis thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Its leaves and stems are used in traditional medicine and as a food source when cooked.
